author: danceratopz
content: Hi! PSA about two recent issues in EEST:

author: danceratopz
content:
1. Open PRs in EEST will have to be rebased on main or include [this commit](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/commit/2813b70414a5894b847f27c99234106c747da588) to get CI to pass, sorry about that!

TLDR: There was an unwanted dependency on execution-specs master AND execution-specs made a breaking change. This  borked filling tests for `Paris` locally and in EEST's CI. Full explanation [here](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/issues/1083#issuecomment-2595249139).

author: danceratopz
content:
2. If you hit this error running `uv` (or `tox`):
```
Installed 13 packages in 6ms
lint: venv> /home/runner/work/_temp/setup-uv-cache/archive-v0/EetQZCfm-NHIf5yLwxK7u/bin/uv venv -p /home/runner/work/_temp/setup-uv-cache/archive-v0/EetQZCfm-NHIf5yLwxK7u/bin/python --allow-existing /home/runner/work/execution-spec-tests/execution-spec-tests/.tox/lint
lint: uv-sync> uv sync --frozen --extra lint --no-dev
error: Failed to parse `uv.lock`
  Caused by: TOML parse error at line 1307, column 10
     |
1307 | wheels = [
     |          ^
failed to parse `pycryptodome-3.15.0-pp27-pypy_73-macosx_10_9_x86_64.whl` as wheel filename: The wheel filename "pycryptodome-3.15.0-pp27-pypy_73-macosx_10_9_x86_64.whl" has an invalid ABI tag: Missing major version in PyPy ABI tag: pypy_73
```
please update `uv`  to 0.5.20, if you curl-installed `uv`, you can simply run:
```
uv self update
```

author: _shemnon
content: Do we need to consider different branches for future fork development?  For example if we are writing a test on a new EIP and want to use the constant from EELS, should we make a local copy of the constant instead?

author: jochembrouwer
content: In EEST do we have fork tests regarding EIP-7691, more specifically a check that we can now have the first fork block with 7/8/9 blobs in them? I don't see a 7691 dir ðŸ¤”

author: marioevz
content: Thereâ€™s no 7691 folder, all tests are in the same folder as 4844, see https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/1082

author: marioevz
content: Basically they are the same tests but re-parametrized with the new values, including the fork transition tests in that PR

author: jochembrouwer
content: Oh right, sorry should have known, since 4844 fixtures are also in the releases. Thanks ðŸ™‚
